Classic Chocolate Chip Cookies

Classic Chocolate Chip Cookies

Ingredients:

  • 1/2 cup unsalted butter (softened)
  • 1/2 cup brown sugar
  • 1/2 cup white sugar
  • 1 whole egg (large)
  • 1 & 1/4 cups all-purpose flour
  • 1 tbsp cornstarch
  • 1/2 tsp baking soda
  • 1/4 tsp salt
  • 1 cup chocolate chips

Instructions:

  1. Cream the butter and sugar together until light and fluffy.
  2. Add the egg and vanilla extract; mix well.
  3. In a separate bowl, combine the flour, cornstarch, baking soda, and salt.
  4. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the creamed mixture, mixing just until combined.
  5. Stir in the chocolate chips.
  6. Drop portions of dough onto a parchment-lined baking sheet.
  7. Bake at 350°F (180°C) for 10-12 minutes or until slightly golden around the edges.
  8. Cool on wire racks.
Delicious Shrimp Tacos

Delicious Shrimp Tacos

Ingredients:

  • 1 lb large shrimp (peeled and deveined)
  • 1 tsp olive oil
  • 1 tsp chili powder
  • 1/2 tsp cumin
  • 1/2 tsp paprika
  • 1/4 tsp garlic powder
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 8 corn tortillas

For the Slaw:

  • 2 cups shredded cabbage
  • 1/2 cup chopped cilantro
  • 1/4 cup diced red onion
  • 1 tbsp lime juice
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Preheat a skillet over medium heat. Add olive oil and sauté the shrimp with chili powder, cumin, paprika, garlic powder, salt, and pepper until cooked through.
  2. Warm the corn tortillas on the skillet or in the microwave.
  3. Assemble the tacos: Place a generous spoonful of slaw on each tortilla, top with shrimp, and garnish with extra cilantro and lime wedges.
  4. Serve immediately and enjoy!
Fettuccine Alfredo with Grilled Chicken

Fettuccine Alfredo with Grilled Chicken

For grilling the chicken:

  • ¼ cup extra virgin olive oil
  • 2 tablespoons white balsamic vinegar or fresh lemon juice
  • 2 tablespoons fresh chopped herbs (basil, oregano, thyme, parsley)
  • 1 large garlic clove, minced
  • ¼ teaspoon salt
  • ½ teaspoon fresh ground black pepper
  • ¼ teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes
  • 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
  • Vegetable oil for oiling the grill grate

For the fettuccine and Alfredo sauce:

  • 8 ounces fettuccine pasta
  • 1 cup heavy cream
  • 1 cup whole milk, or half and half
  • 3 tablespoons unsalted butter
  • ½ teaspoon salt
  • 1 teaspoon fresh ground black pepper
  • 1 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese
  • 2 tablespoons fresh chopped parsley, for garnish

Instructions:

  1. Mix all the marinade ingredients (olive oil, vinegar, herbs, garlic, salt, and pepper) in a gallon-size zipper-lock plastic bag. Add the chicken breasts and turn to coat. Refrigerate, turning a few times, for at least 3 hours and up to 24 hours.
  2. Preheat a gas grill on high with the lid closed for 15 minutes or until very hot. Clean the grill grate with a brush. Using tongs and paper towels soaked in vegetable oil, wipe the grates with the oil to prevent sticking.
  3. Turn the heat to medium and grill the chicken for about 6-8 minutes, then turn and continue cooking for another 5 minutes or until clear juices are visible and the chicken is cooked through. Tent the chicken with foil and allow it to rest for 15 minutes.
  4. Slice and keep warm while preparing the Alfredo sauce. The chicken can also be made ahead of time and refrigerated until needed. If refrigerated, bring the chicken to room temperature for 30 minutes before adding to the sauce. There is no need to rewarm as it will be added to the hot noodles and sauce in the end.
  5. Heat a large pot of water on the stove to cook the fettuccine while preparing the Alfredo sauce.
  6. Pour 1 cup of milk, ½ cup of the cream, and the butter in a medium saucepan. Cook over medium heat until the mixture simmers.
  7. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer gently until the mixture is reduced to about ¾ cup, about 20 minutes. Off heat, stir in the remaining ½ cup of cream, salt, and pepper.
  8. Meanwhile, add the pasta to the boiling water and cook until al dente, according to package directions. Reserve ¼ cup of the pasta cooking water, then drain the pasta.
  9. Return the fettuccine back to the large pot and add 2 tablespoons of the reserved pasta water. Toss to coat and cover to keep warm.
  10. Return the cream mixture to simmer over medium-high heat, then reduce to low and add the Parmesan cheese. Cook over low heat until the Parmesan is melted, about 2 minutes.
  11. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons of pasta water to the Alfredo sauce and pour over the cooked fettuccine. Toss the pasta and Alfredo sauce using tongs to mix. The sauce may seem a little thin but will thicken as it cools.
  12. Divide the fettuccine between 4 warm bowls and top with ½ a sliced chicken breast on each serving. Serve immediately, garnished with chopped parsley leaves, fresh ground pepper, and more Parmesan if desired.
